name: Arduino Nano LED Blink (No Resistor)
description: Basic LED blink using Arduino Nano without any resistor. LED is connected directly to a digital pin to demonstrate the simplest blinking example.
howItWorks: Arduino toggles the D13 pin HIGH and LOW with a delay, causing the LED to blink. The LED is connected directly without resistor, which works for demonstration but is not safe for long-term use.
powerNotes: Circuit is powered using a 9V battery connected to VIN and GND.
safetyNotes: Not recommended for continuous use because LED can draw excess current.
Ensure correct battery polarity to avoid damage.
Running without resistor is only safe for quick testing.
